str2: Stimulation, provocation, irritation, angry dispute. From paroxuno; incitement, or dispute.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
To separate from; mid: I part; pass: To be swept aside. From apo and chorizo; to rend apart; reflexively, to separate.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
Of Chaldee origin; son of Nabas; Barnabas, an Israelite.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and lambano; to receive near, i.e. Associate with oneself; by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn.
Of Latin origin; Marcus, a Christian.
To sail out (of harbor), sail away. From ek and pleo; to depart by ship.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Cyprus. Of uncertain origin; Cyprus, an island in the Mediterranean.
